div.em: Current conditions as of 19 Apr 15:35 pm CDT

div.div: Showers likely and possibly a thunderstorm. Mostly cloudy, with a high near 64. Northeast wind around 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts of less than a tenth of an inch, except higher amounts possible in thunderstorms.

Showers likely and possibly a thunderstorm before 7pm. Mostly cloudy, then gradually becoming mostly clear, with a low around 44. Northeast wind 5 to 10 mph becoming light north in the evening. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New precipitation amounts of less than a tenth of an inch, except higher amounts possible in thunderstorms.
Mostly cloudy, then gradually becoming sunny, with a high near 70. Calm wind becoming southwest around 5 mph in the afternoon.

span.span: Tahlequah Public Schools Employees: Please take a moment to review your rights under the new Families First Coronavirus Response Act (FFCRA)
These provisions will apply from April 1, 2020 through December 31, 2020. You may contact Human Resources with any questions or concerns related to the new FFCRA, 918-458-4190 or

div.p: It is the policy of the Tahlequah Board of Education District 1035 that no person shall on the grounds of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital or veteran status, or qualified disability be excluded from participation in, be denied the benefits of, or be otherwise subjected to discrimination under any education programs, activities, services, or in admissions, financial aid, recruitment, consideration, selection or employment whether full-time or part-time, or any other activity for which the Board of Education is responsible.

li.a: Board Policy 6203: Bullying, Harassment & Intimidation Policy

a.aria-label: Read more about Lunch Pickup for Students

span.span: Below are a few updates and clarifications I would like to share with you:
Please realize this is not a Tahlequah Public Schools decision, we have no choice but to move to a “distance learning model”. This is mandated by the State of Oklahoma.
We do not have enough technology devices available to provide to students.
“Distance learning” will look different based on your situation, if you do not have internet or a device we will provide paper or alternative lessons.
Administrators and staff will work with you and your student to make this as smooth as possible.
There will be a survey on Facebook and our website regarding access to internet and devices. Staff will also be contacting individual families and students as early as next week.
Our distance learning program will start April 6 and will end May 8. May 8 will be the official end to the 2019-2020 school year.

Graduation has not been cancelled. But given the trend nationwide it would be foolish of us to not make alternative plans for the possible extension of public gathering regulations. If local, state and federal regulations allow, graduation will take place on the current date. If not, we will look to move the date to later in the summer. If that is not possible we will look at alternative options.

This is something no one here has gone through before just like everyone in our community. We will do our best to serve your children in any way possible during this time. We will make mistakes and we will adjust along the way.
